metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45911 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in gif2apng 1.9. There is a heap-based buffer overflow in the main function. It allows an attacker to write 2 bytes outside the boundaries of the buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gif2apng - 1.9+srconly-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gif2apng package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9+srconly-3ubuntu0.1').
